page.title: 01 COTTON.(Staffs.)
page.content: Cotton lies to the East of Cheadle and is situated on the lower slopes of the Weaver Hills,about 8OO ft.above sea level,on the Staffordshire Moorlands. Close by is the River Churnet which is fed by the stream from Cotton Dell,a narrow wooded glen,where many unusual birds like Nuthatchers,Tree Creepers, Greater Spotted Woodpeckers and Jays are found. Some parts of the area are composed of Limestone and Millstone Grit and others of Red Sandstone,which, being porous,ensures a high degree of dryness after heavy rain. Agriculture is the chief occupation but Extractive Industry (British Industrial Sand) is also present. Population is sparse but there are an abundance of trees and fields in this very hilly area with some roads being as steep as 1 in 5 and with very little in the way of public transport.
